methodologyTable.name: Time Series Modeling
methodologyTable.description: A Comprehensive Approach to Optimized Budget Allocation Using Adaptive Time-Series Models with Adstock and Hill Functions. Abstract: This report explores a systematic approach to optimizing budget allocation for marketing expenditures. We begin with a baseline Optimized Budget Allocation, followed by an Optimized Budget Allocation per Month (Adaptive Time-Series Model), and culminate with the Final Optimized Budget Allocation per Month (Adaptive Time-Series Model with Adstock + Hill). Each phase incorporates increasingly sophisticated modeling techniques to enhance resource allocation efficiency. Our findings demonstrate the impact of adaptive optimization and carryover effects on improving marketing effectiveness.

methodologyTable.name: Optimal Marketing Budget Allocation
methodologyTable.description: A Bilevel Optimization Approach. Abstract: This paper presents a comprehensive methodology for optimizing marketing budget allocation across multiple channels using a bilevel optimization framework. The approach addresses the challenge of determining effective weight parameters for each marketing channel and subsequently optimizing budget allocation to maximize return on investment. Two complementary models are developed and compared: one utilizing the difference between future GMV (Gross Merchandise Value) and investment as the optimization target, and another using direct GMV values. The methodology incorporates channel-specific constraints, handles diminishing returns through logarithmic utility functions, and provides robust allocation recommendations despite limited historical data. Empirical results demonstrate the effectiveness of the approach, providing marketing managers with data-driven, actionable insights for budget allocation decisions.

methodologyTable.name: Robyn MMM Model from Meta
methodologyTable.description: Robyn is an experimental, AI/ML-powered and open-sourced Marketing Mix Modeling (MMM) package from Meta Marketing Science. The automation is enabled through various techniques like the multi-objective evolutionary algorithm for hyperparameter optimisation, time-series decomposition for trend & season, Ridge regression for model fitting & gradient-based optimizer for budget allocation. Robyn is built for granular datasets with many independent variables and therefore especially suitable for digital and direct response advertisers with rich data sources.

glossaryItems.definition: Return on Investment - A performance measure used to evaluate the efficiency of an investment.
Click-Through Rate - The ratio of users who click on a specific link to the number of total users who view a page, email, or advertisement.
Cost Per Acquisition - The total cost of acquiring a new customer, including marketing and sales expenses.
Return on Ad Spend - A marketing metric that measures the revenue earned for every dollar spent on advertising.
Customer Acquisition Cost - The cost of convincing a potential customer to buy a product or service.
Lifetime Value - The total worth of a customer to a business over the whole period of their relationship.
Cost Per Click - The actual price paid for each click in pay-per-click marketing campaigns.
Cost Per Mille - The cost an advertiser pays for one thousand views or impressions of an advertisement.
Marketing Qualified Lead - A lead that has been deemed more likely to become a customer compared to other leads.
Sales Qualified Lead - A prospective customer that has been researched and vetted by the marketing team and deemed ready for the next stage in the sales process.
